Title: Binding from Compendium of Medicine
Medium: red leather with light brown leather doublures
Description: This red leather binding with a flap is contemporary with the manuscript, Walters W.595. The binding has central ovals and cornerpieces. The central motif has an inner element shaped in the form of a diamond. The doublures are of light brown leather decorated with filigree work, central ovals, and cornerpieces.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Book; Codex; Colophon; Illumination; Manuscript; Contemporary Binding; Iran; Science -- Medicine
Provenance: 'Ali [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [ownership statement (min kutub) and seal on fol. 1a]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Iranian
